title: SB 1.18.8-10 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 31-03-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya
Chakshurunmilitam Jena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvijesha Shunyavadi Pachachyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadhadhara Shiva Sadi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Devi Saraswati Vyasam
Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from three verses
verses 8, 9 and 10.
of the 18th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
So first verse number 8
Kimnu Baleshu Surena
Kalina Dheera Bhiruna
Apramatta Pramateshu
Yovruko Nrushu Vartate
The meaning of this eighth verse
Maharaj Parikshit considered
that less intelligent men
might find the personality
of Kali to be very powerful
but those
who are self-controlled would have nothing to fear.
The king was powerful like a tiger
and took care of the foolish careless persons.
So very important description of the
protection given by Parikshit Maharaj
to the
people of his kingdom.
The Purport to the Prabhupada says,
The Purport to the Prabhupada says,
Those who are not devotees of the Lord
are careless and unintelligent.
Why is this said?
Because unless one is thoroughly intelligent,
one cannot be a devotee of the Lord.
Ye Krishna bhaje sei bada chatura
The statement of Chaitanya Charitamrita.
One who is a devotee of Krishna is actually very intelligent.
So only an intelligent person takes to devotional service.
This intelligence is not ordinary material intelligence.
It is actually spiritual intelligence.
Spiritual intelligence is little different.
What is spiritual intelligence?
How is it different from material intelligence?
Material intelligence is to be able to use one's intelligence for
eating, sleeping, mating, defending.
defending for sense satisfaction for some bodily meeting bodily demands that
intelligence even the animals have the birds have it all creatures have that
intelligence is not being talked of here the intelligence to actually try to
understand God try to understand what is spirit engage in spiritual activities
for eternal benefit ultimate welfare that is spiritual intelligence and that
is different that is not necessarily connected with the material intelligence
so those who are not devotees of the Lord fall prey to the actions of Kali
Kali can influence somebody who is not a devotee what will be Kali's influence
like they will be enticed into engaging in sinful activities like meat-eating
intoxication gambling illicit sex or earn a lot of money for sense
gratification these are all the
evil influence of Kali on unintelligent people and who are these
unintelligent people they are basically not devotees of Krishna it will not be
possible to bring about a saner condition in society unless we are
prepared to accept the modes of action adopted by Maharaj Pariksit that is
propagation of the devotional service of the Lord to the common man
so in this society if we want to avoid Kali's influence if we want people to be
protected then we have to propagate this devotional service among the common
people that is absolutely essential if at all we want to drive away Kali or
keep people protected against evil influence of Kali
Mata-Bhagavatam.
The ninth verse
Upavaranyitam etad vah
Punyam Pariksitam Maya
Vasudeva Kathopetam
Aakhyanam yad aprichathah
The meaning of this ninth verse is

life must submissively hear all topics that are connected with the transcendental activities and
qualities of the personality of Godhead who acts wonderfully. Krishna's activities are all
wonderful because he's a wonderful personality. Extraordinary personality. Completely transcendental
in whatever activities he performs. And he also, Krishna also performs his Leelas with his devotees.
Okay?
So, we should hear topics connected with the transcendental activities of the personality of Godhead.
Because he's always with his devotees. In a purport, Srila Prabhupada says, the systematic hearing of the
transcendental activities, qualities and names of Lord Sri Krishna pushes one towards eternal life.
This is described elsewhere in the Bhagavatam.
Here in the
first chapter,
in the first canto,
in the second canto,
this is described.
You should make a program to systematically hear the Bhagavatam.
Bhagavatam is a very big scripture.
18,000 verses.
But hear little by little by little every day.
And what will happen if you hear every day?
It is said here that
you go on hearing, hearing, hearing Bhagavath Shravan. Hearing Srimad Bhagavatam every day.
Prabhupada instituted the system of having a Bhagavatam discourse every day in the temple.
And if you cannot come to the temple, you can watch the Bhagavatam discourse on the channel,
on the broadcast channel.
You can hear the Bhagavatam discourse.
So, systematic hearing.
Every day you hear.
Little, little, little, little.
And if you cannot hear at the time the class is conducted,
because morning you may be busy,
class happens in the morning,
then you can hear later in the day or in the evening,
or in the evening,
or in the evening,
or in the evening,
or in the evening,
or in the evening,
or in the evening.
And you can hear the Bhagavatam discourse.
You are hearing the same discourse.
It is stored.
So, by simply hearing, hearing, hearing, hearing, hearing,
you are progressing towards eternal life.
Systematic hearing means knowing Him gradually in truth and in fact.
See.
You know factually about Krishna,
not as an imaginary person,
not some sentiment,
but in actuality become realized about Krishna's personality.
It is very, very special.
And knowing Krishna in truth and fact means attaining eternal life,
as stated in Bhagavad Gita.
Bhagavad Gita says that anyone who knows Krishna in truth and fact,
Krishna says,
janma karma chame divyam evam yo veti tatvatah tyatva deham punar janma neti mam eti sorjuna.
Simply by knowing in truth and fact,
in truth and fact about Krishna,
means attaining eternal life.
Tyatva deham punar janma neti mam eti.
One goes back to the spiritual abode of the Supreme Lord,
and attains eternal life in association with Him.
Punar janma neti.
So, that's why Prabhupada is saying here,
make a habit of hearing Bhagavatam every day,
and your life will be successful.
Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
